subject: Relationships
title: Gaslighting: Making You Doubt Reality
description: A 60-second lesson on Gaslighting: Making You Doubt Reality.

hook.text: 'That never happened.' 'You're imagining things.' Slowly, you start trusting their memory more than your own.

buildup.text: Gaslighting is a manipulation tactic where the abuser makes the victim question their own reality and sanity.

discovery.text: The term comes from a 1944 film where a husband dims gaslights and denies it, making his wife think she's insane.

twist.text: Gaslighting works because humans naturally trust their partners. We're wired to believe the people we love.

climax.text: The most insidious abuse isn't hitting you. It's making you believe your own perception can't be trusted.

punchline.text: Gaslighting doesn't change reality. It makes you stop trusting yours.

quiz.question: Where does the term 'gaslighting' come from?
options: A 1944 film about a manipulative husband
